page.title: 08The Manchester Ship Canal
page.content: In recent years the volume of traffic on the Manchester Ship Canal has been in decline. This is largely due to the closure of docks to the east of Stanlow, and in particular the closure of Salford docks. However, sea going vessels still use the Cawoods container dock,which has a regular trade with Eastern Europe. The Ship Canal is also used by smaller oil tankers making their way to and from Stanlow Oil Refinery. The number of vessels continuing this trade has fallen dramatically in the last 20 years as greater use is now made of pipelins to deeper offshore anchorage points.
